result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frederick D Ruppert

records.addlTxt: from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report

2:00 PM Defendant Frederick D Ruppert in court.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Fallon Villar in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Deft indicates he does not want an atty.
State puts their offer on the record.
Deft indicates if he completes anger management that the charges would be dismissed.
Deft indicates he is working on completing anger management.
State indicates her notes for the file make sense now.
BTC: Matter adjourned for deft to complete anger management.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:58 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Frederick D Ruppert in court. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Deft has gone to the SPD's office but does not qualify.
Deft has not tried to hire an atty on his own.
Atty rights explained to the deft.
State to extend an offer to the deft.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's statements
State's Notice of Intent to introduce 911 recordings
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim L.P(person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Frederick D Ruppert appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove and Attorney Daryl Watts appeared by video for Frederick D Ruppert. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
